page.title: 12FARMING IN LOWER PENARTH.
page.content: The tenant farmer has lived at,and well_farmed Cosmeston for 26 years.A gradual introduction of chemical aids has led to improved crop production, more effective animal health measures, and improved machinery,together with the dedicated expertise of Mr.Forse, has contributed towards the successful and changing farming pattern.A full_ time worker assists him,while extra invaluable help is given by his wife and son.Casual labour is employed at busy times on seasonal tasks.Jobs such as silage_making,hedge cutting,sheep dipping and shearing,are specific,so contractors must be engaged.The farmer is sympathetic to other's needs,damage from trespassers who overspill on his land from nearby developments affect his attitude.Routine has stopped the Forse's from taking a break,so retire_ ment offers their only chance to do so
